channel.title: NPR Topics: Technology
channel.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What does TikTok's new ownership mean for users in the U.S.?
item.description: Since news about TikTok finalizing a deal to spin-off its U.S. operations became public, users have questioned what U.S. ownership of the app means for them.
item.content:encoded: Since news about TikTok finalizing a deal to spin-off its U.S. operations became public, users have questioned what U.S. ownership of the app means for them.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Meta and YouTube head to trial over harm to children after TikTok settles
item.description: A trial kicking off in a Los Angeles courtroom marks the first time a jury will hear claims that social media companies knowingly hook young users and cause harm.
item.content:encoded:
A trial kicking off in a Los Angeles courtroom marks the first time a jury will hear claims that social media companies knowingly hook young users and cause harm.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: In China, AI is no longer optional for some kids. It's part of the curriculum
item.description: While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it's become a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.
item.content:encoded:
While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it's become a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.

(Image credit: John Ruwitch)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: TikTok is investigating why some users can't write 'Epstein' in messages
item.description: The issue around the word "Epstein" comes as users experience outages and functionality problems since the popular video app was recently sold to a group of mostly U.S. investors, including Trump ally Larry Ellison.
item.content:encoded:
The issue around the word "Epstein" comes as users experience outages and functionality problems since the popular video app was recently sold to a group of mostly U.S. investors, including Trump ally Larry Ellison.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Why the latest iPhone update is leaving ordinary users and tech experts grumbling
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to digital writer Patrick Holland about why some iPhone users dislike the latest iOS update.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to digital writer Patrick Holland about why some iPhone users dislike the latest iOS update.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Gladys West, mathematician whose work paved the way for GPS, dies at 95
item.description: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of lives — and keep us from getting lost.
item.content:encoded: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of lives — and keep us from getting lost.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: The Trump administration admits even more ways DOGE accessed sensitive personal data
item.description: New court documents reveal even more ways DOGE improperly accessed and shared sensitive personal data last year — and how that data appears to have been used to advance dubious fraud claims.
item.content:encoded:
New court documents reveal even more ways DOGE improperly accessed and shared sensitive personal data last year — and how that data appears to have been used to advance dubious fraud claims.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: TikTok finalizes deal to form new American entity
item.description: TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States that has been in discussion for years.
item.content:encoded:
TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States that has been in discussion for years.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Are 'passkeys' better than passwords? This security expert says yes
item.description: Has your phone been prompting you for months to log into certain sites with a "passkey"? Security writer Kim Key of PC Mag explains why you might want to ditch your passwords in favor of passkeys.
item.content:encoded: Has your phone been prompting you for months to log into certain sites with a "passkey"? Security writer Kim Key of PC Mag explains why you might want to ditch your passwords in favor of passkeys.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: Do phone sleep trackers work?
item.description: Are sleep trackers on your phone helping you get a full night's rest? NPR's Life Kit investigates.
item.content:encoded: Are sleep trackers on your phone helping you get a full night's rest? NPR's Life Kit investigates.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle
